docs.text: 外企退役电脑,平板,手机及显示器出售  德国软件企业 退役的电子产品（笔记本电脑，平板电脑，苹果手机…）,低价出售，数量有限不要错过。 包含： ThinkPad，Surface， MacBook Pro，MacBook Air， iPad Air， iPad Mini，iPhone。 我们公司员工笔记本电脑等设备都是每三年可以重新采购新的，因为是软件公司，虽然是三年前的，但是配置不过时，所有设备配置性能都比较高，都是给专业人士配置的设备。 以前退役的电子设备都是统一卖给第三方公司，应广大员工要求，今年开始可以低价回购电子设备。每次批次只能抢到少量，所以数量有限。 原价 8 千~1 万 Thinkpad，价在才 2 千多 原价 2 万多的MackBook，现价 4 千多 iPhone，iPad才 1 千左右 根据设备保养程度和年限，价格会有少量差异。 预购或咨询电话：18180931223 MacBook Pro  图片 价格 状态 详情 5160 已售 查看更多图片 MacBook Air  图片 价格 状态 详情 4365 已售 查看更多图片 iPad Mini  图片 价格 状态 详情 1380 已售 查看更多图片 1160 在售 查看更多图片 1280 已售 查看更多图片
docs.title: 在售商品

docs.text: Page last revised on: 2019-10-15 Mkdocs  Styling your docs Theme material  Colors  theme : palette : primary : "indigo" accent : "indigo" Logo  Your logo should have rectangular shape with a minimum resolution of 128x128, leave some room towards the edges and be composed of high contrast areas on a transparent ground, as it will be placed on the colored header bar and drawer. Simply create the folder docs/images, add your logo and embed it with: theme : logo : "images/logo.svg" Additionally, the default icon can be changed by setting an arbitrary ligature (or Unicode code point) from the Material Design icon font, e.g. theme : logo : icon : "cloud" Disqus  https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/getting-started/#disqus Material for MkDocs is integrated with Disqus , so if you want to add a comments section to your documentation set the shortname of your Disqus project in your mkdocs.yml : extra : disqus : "your-shortname" The comments section is inserted on every page, except the index page . Additionally, a new entry at the bottom of the table of contents is generated that is linking to the comments section. The necessary JavaScript is automatically included. Requirements site_url value must be set in mkdocs.yml for the Disqus integration to load properly. Disqus can also be enabled or disabled for specific pages using Metadata . --- title: Writing your docs disqus: your-shortname --- Plugins  mkdocs_macros_plugin  Regular variables can be defined in three ways: global (for contributors): in the mkdocs.yml file, under the 'extra' heading global (for programmers): in a main.py file (Python), by adding them to a dictionary local (for contributors): in the markdown file, with a statement The unit price of product A is 100 EUR.
docs.title: Styling your docs

docs.text: Your logo should have rectangular shape with a minimum resolution of 128x128, leave some room towards the edges and be composed of high contrast areas on a transparent ground, as it will be placed on the colored header bar and drawer. Simply create the folder docs/images, add your logo and embed it with: theme : logo : "images/logo.svg" Additionally, the default icon can be changed by setting an arbitrary ligature (or Unicode code point) from the Material Design icon font, e.g. theme : logo : icon : "cloud"
docs.title: Logo

docs.text: https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/getting-started/#disqus Material for MkDocs is integrated with Disqus , so if you want to add a comments section to your documentation set the shortname of your Disqus project in your mkdocs.yml : extra : disqus : "your-shortname" The comments section is inserted on every page, except the index page . Additionally, a new entry at the bottom of the table of contents is generated that is linking to the comments section. The necessary JavaScript is automatically included. Requirements site_url value must be set in mkdocs.yml for the Disqus integration to load properly. Disqus can also be enabled or disabled for specific pages using Metadata . --- title: Writing your docs disqus: your-shortname ---
docs.title: Disqus

docs.text: Regular variables can be defined in three ways: global (for contributors): in the mkdocs.yml file, under the 'extra' heading global (for programmers): in a main.py file (Python), by adding them to a dictionary local (for contributors): in the markdown file, with a statement The unit price of product A is 100 EUR.

docs.text:
Page last revised on: 2019-10-15 This is the first paragraph of the document. Prettier Ignore  Mark  Mark Example ==mark me== ==smart==mark== mark me smart==mark Critic  Critic Markup uses special markup to insert, delete, substitute, highlight, and comment. To insert or remove text you can use insert me and remove me respectively. You can also denote a substitution with substitute this with this . You can also highlight specific text with highlight me . Or even comment, which is generally done by highlighting text and following it with a comment: highlight me Add a comment . Critic Markup Preview Example Here is some incorrect Markdown. I am adding this here . Here is some more text that I am removing text. And here is even more text that I am adding. Paragraph was deleted and replaced with some spaces. Spaces were removed and a paragraph was added. And here is a comment on some text This works quite well. I just wanted to comment on it. . Substitutions is are great! General block handling. test remove test remove test remove test remove test remove test add test add test add test add test add CodeHilite  CodeHilite ``` python import tensorflow as tf ``` import tensorflow as tf via three colons :::python import tensorflow as tf import tensorflow as tf CodeHilite uses Pygments , a generic syntax highlighter with support for over 300 languages , so the following list of examples is just an excerpt. Admonition  https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/extensions/admonition/ Admonition !!! note You should note that the title will be automatically capitalized. Note You should note that the title will be automatically capitalized. !!! node "Changing the title" You should note that the title will be changed. Changing the title You should note that the title will be changed. !!! node "" You should note that the title will be removed. You should note that the title will be removed. ??? node "Collapsible blocks" You should note that the content will be collapsed. Using `???+`, blocks can be rendered open by default. Collapsible blocks You should note that the content will be collapsed. Using ???+ , blocks can be rendered open by default. Admonition Types !!! note Qualifiers: - note - seealso Note Qualifiers: note seealso !!! abstract Qualifiers: - abstract - summary - tldr Abstract Qualifiers: abstract summary tldr !!! info Qualifiers: - info - todo Info Qualifiers: info todo !!! tip Qualifiers: - tip - hint - important Tip Qualifiers: tip hint important !!! Success Qualifiers: - success - check - done Success Qualifiers: success check done !!! question Qualifiers: - question - help - faq Question Qualifiers: question help faq !!! warning Qualifiers: - warning - caution - attention Warning Qualifiers: warning caution attention !!! failure Qualifiers: - failure - fail - missing Failure Qualifiers: failure fail missing !!! danger Qualifiers: - danger - error Danger Qualifiers: danger error !!! bug Qualifiers: - bug Bug Qualifiers: bug !!! example Qualifiers: - example - snippet Example Qualifiers: example snippet !!! quote Qualifiers: - quote - cite Quote Qualifiers: quote cite ???+ settings In order to style these we mainly remove the list type style and adjust the margins to align with normal list styles. ```css .markdown-body .task-list-item { list-style-type: none !important; } .markdown-body .task-list-item input[type="checkbox"] { margin: 0 4px 0.25em -20px; vertical-align: middle; } ``` Settings In order to style these we mainly remove the list type style and adjust the margins to align with normal list styles. . markdown-body . task-list-item { list-style-type : none !important ; } . markdown-body . task-list-item input [ type = "checkbox" ] { margin : 0 4 px 0.25 em -20 px ; vertical-align : middle ; } Definition Lists  Apple Pomaceous fruit of plants of the genus Malus in the family Rosaceae. Orange The fruit of an evergreen tree of the genus Citrus. Fenced Code Blocks  # python code < p > HTML Document Tasklist  Task List Example All task lists in this documentation are generated with custom_checkbox enabled. Task List - [X] item 1 * [X] item A * [ ] item B more text + [x] item a + [ ] item b + [x] item c * [X] item C - [ ] item 2 - [ ] item 3 Task List item 1 item A item B more text item a item b item c item C item 2 item 3 Tables  Tables | First Header | Second Header | | ------------ | ------------- | | Content Cell | Content Cell | | Content Cell | Content Cell | | left | center | right | | :--- | :----: | ----: | | aaaa | bbbbbb | ccccc | | a | b | c | First Header Second Header Content Cell Content Cell Content Cell Content Cell left center right aaaa bbbbbb ccccc a b c Emoji  control + command + space 👍 👎 🎊 🎉 😁 ❤️ 💩 👻 SuperFences  https://facelessuser.github.io/pymdown-extensions/extensions/superfences/ Tabbed Code ```Bash tab= #!/bin/bash STR="Hello World!" echo $STR ``` ```C tab= #include int main(void) { printf("hello, world "); } ``` ```C++ tab= #include int main() { std::cout << "Hello, world! "; return 0; } ``` ```C# tab= using System; class Program { static void Main(string[] args) { Console.WriteLine("Hello, world!"); } } ``` Bash #!/bin/bash STR = "Hello World!" echo $STR C #include int main(void) { printf ( "hello, world " ); } C++ #include int main () { std :: cout << "Hello, world! " ; return 0 ; } C# using System ; class Program { static void Main ( string [] args ) { Console . WriteLine ( "Hello, world!" ); } } HTML < div class = "superfences-tabs" > < input name = "__tabs_1" type = "radio" id = "__tab_1_0" checked = "checked" > < label for = "__tab_1_0" > Tab 0 < div class = "superfences-content" > ... ... < input name = "__tabs_1" type = "radio" id = "__tab_1_X" checked = "checked" > < label for = "__tab_1_X" > Tab X < div class = "superfences-content" > ... ... CSS . superfences-tabs { display : flex ; position : relative ; flex-wrap : wrap ; } . superfences-tabs . highlight { background : #ddd ; } . superfences-tabs . superfences-content { display : none ; order : 99 ; width : 100 % ; } . superfences-tabs label { width : auto ; margin : 0 0.5 em ; padding : 0.25 em ; font-size : 120 % ; cursor : pointer ; } . superfences-tabs input { position : absolute ; opacity : 0 ; } . superfences-tabs input : nth-child ( n + 1 ) { color : #333333 ; } . superfences-tabs input : nth-child ( n + 1 ) : checked + label { color : #FF5252 ; } . superfences-tabs input : nth-child ( n + 1 ) : checked + label + . superfences-content { display : block ; } Line Number Example Source ``` linenums="1" import foo.bar ``` Output import foo.bar Special Line Example Source ``` linenums="1 1 2" """Some file.""" import foo.bar import boo.baz import foo.bar.baz ``` Output """Some file.""" import foo.bar import boo.baz import foo.bar.baz Highlight Lines with Line Numbers Example Source ```hl_lines="1 3" linenums="2" """Some file.""" import foo.bar import boo.baz import foo.bar.baz ``` Output """Some file.""" import foo.bar import boo.baz import foo.bar.baz https://facelessuser.github.io/pymdown-extensions/extensions/superfences/#uml-diagram-example Flow Chart Example Output st=>start: Start:>http://www.google.com[blank] e=>end:>http://www.google.com op1=>operation: My Operation sub1=>subroutine: My Subroutine cond=>condition: Yes or No?:>http://www.google.com io=>inputoutput: catch something... st->op1->cond cond(yes)->io->e cond(no)->sub1(right)->op1 Source ```flow st=>start: Start:>http://www.google.com[blank] e=>end:>http://www.google.com op1=>operation: My Operation sub1=>subroutine: My Subroutine cond=>condition: Yes or No?:>http://www.google.com io=>inputoutput: catch something... st->op1->cond cond(yes)->io->e cond(no)->sub1(right)->op1 ``` Sequence Diagram Example Output Title: Here is a title A->B: Normal line B-->C: Dashed line C->>D: Open arrow D-->>A: Dashed open arrow Source ```sequence Title: Here is a title A->B: Normal line B-->C: Dashed line C->>D: Open arrow D-->>A: Dashed open arrow ``` https://mermaidjs.github.io/ Flow Diagram Example Output graph TD; A-->B; A-->C; B-->D; C-->D; Source ```mermaid graph TD; A-->B; A-->C; B-->D; C-->D; ``` Sequence Diagram Example Output sequenceDiagram participant Alice participant Bob Alice->John: Hello John, how are you? loop Healthcheck John->John: Fight against hypochondria end Note right of John: Rational thoughts
prevail... John-->Alice: Great! John->Bob: How about you? Bob-->John: Jolly good! Source ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Alice participant Bob Alice->John: Hello John, how are you? loop Healthcheck John->John: Fight against hypochondria end Note right of John: Rational thoughts
prevail... John-->Alice: Great! John->Bob: How about you? Bob-->John: Jolly good! ``` Gantt Diagram Example Output gantt dateFormat YYYY-MM-DD title Adding GANTT diagram functionality to mermaid section A section Completed task :done, des1, 2014-01-06,2014-01-08 Active task :active, des2, 2014-01-09, 3d Future task : des3, after des2, 5d Future task2 : des4, after des3, 5d section Critical tasks Completed task in the critical line :crit, done, 2014-01-06,24h Implement parser and jison :crit, done, after des1, 2d Create tests for parser :crit, active, 3d Future task in critical line :crit, 5d Create tests for renderer :2d Add to mermaid :1d Source ```mermaid gantt dateFormat YYYY-MM-DD title Adding GANTT diagram functionality to mermaid section A section Completed task :done, des1, 2014-01-06,2014-01-08 Active task :active, des2, 2014-01-09, 3d Future task : des3, after des2, 5d Future task2 : des4, after des3, 5d section Critical tasks Completed task in the critical line :crit, done, 2014-01-06,24h Implement parser and jison :crit, done, after des1, 2d Create tests for parser :crit, active, 3d Future task in critical line :crit, 5d Create tests for renderer :2d Add to mermaid :1d ``` MagicLink  Auto-Linking Example - Just paste links directly in the document like this: https://google.com. - Or even an email address: fake.email@email.com. Just paste links directly in the document like this: https://google.com . Or even an email address: fake.email@email.com . Tilde  Subscript Example CH~3~CH~2~OH text~a\ subscript\ example~ CH 3 CH 2 OH text a subscript example Caret  Insert Example ^^Insert me^^ Insert me Superscript Example H^2^0 text^a\ superscript\ example^ H 2 0 text a superscript example SmartSymbols  Markdown Result (tm) ™ (c) © (r) ® c/o ℅ +/- ± --> → <-- ← <--> ↔ =/= ≠ 1/4, etc. ¼, etc. 1st 2nd etc. 1 st 2 nd etc. ProgressBar  https://facelessuser.github.io/pymdown-extensions/extensions/progressbar/ Progress Bar Example [=0% "0%"] [=5% "5%"] [=25% "25%"] [=45% "45%"] [=65% "65%"] [=85% "85%"] [=100% "100%"] 0% 5% 25% 45% 65% 85% 100% Progress Bar with Attributes [=0%]{: .thin} [=5%]{: .thin} [=25%]{: .thin} [=45%]{: .thin} [=65%]{: .thin} [=85%]{: .thin} [=100%]{: .thin} Snippets  *[Toc]: Table of Contents *[GFM]: GitHub Flavored Markdown *[FAQ]: Frequent Asked Questions [abbreviations]: https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/abbreviations/ [aspell]: http://aspell.net/ [attr-list]: https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/attr_list/ [bleach]: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/bleach [codehilite]: https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/code_hilite/ [coverage]: https://coverage.readthedocs.io [critic-markup]: http://criticmarkup.com/ [def-list]: https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/definition_lists/ [emojione]: https://github.com/Ranks/emojione [emojione-awesome-css]: https://github.com/Ranks/emojione/blob/master/extras/css/emojione-awesome.css [emojione-sprites-svg]: https://github.com/Ranks/emojione/blob/v2.2.7/assets/sprites/emojione.sprites.svg [flake8]: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/flake8 [flake8-docstrings]: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/flake8-docstrings [flowchart-js]: http://adrai.github.io/flowchart.js/ [footnotes]: https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/footnotes/ [gemoji]: https://github.com/github/gemoji [github-api-emoji]: https://developer.github.com/v3/emojis/ [github-api-oauth]: https://developer.github.com/v3/oauth/ [highlightjs]: https://highlightjs.org/ [katex]: https://github.com/Khan/KaTeX [mathjax]: http://www.mathjax.org/ [mkdocs]: https://github.com/mkdocs/mkdocs [mkdocs-material]: https://github.com/squidfunk/mkdocs-material [nested-markdown]: https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/extra/#nested-markdown-inside-html-blocks [nl2br]: https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/nl2br/ [octicons]: https://octicons.github.com/ [pep8-naming]: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pep8-naming [pygments]: http://pygments.org/ [pymdown-styles]: https://github.com/facelessuser/pymdown-styles/tree/master/pymdown_styles [pytest]: http://doc.pytest.org/en/latest/ [python-markdown]: https://github.com/Python-Markdown/markdown [pyyaml]: https://github.com/yaml/pyyaml [raphael-js]: http://dmitrybaranovskiy.github.io/raphael/ [requests]: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/requests/ [sequence-diagram-js]: http://bramp.github.io/js-sequence-diagrams/ [tables]: https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/tables/ [toc]: https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/toc/ [tox]: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/tox [twemoji]: https://github.com/twitter/twemoji [underscore-js]: http://underscorejs.org/ [unicode-norm]: http://unicode.org/reports/tr15/#Norm_Forms Metadata  https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/extensions/metadata/ The Metadata extension makes it possible to add metadata to a document which gives more control over the theme in a page-specific context. Footnotes  https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/extensions/footnotes/ Footnotes 1 have a label 2 and the footnote's content. This is a footnote content. ↩ A footnote on the label: "@#$%". ↩ The first paragraph of the definition. Paragraph two of the definition. A blockquote with multiple lines. a code block A final paragraph. ↩

Or even comment, which is generally done by highlighting text and following it with a comment: highlight me Add a comment . Critic Markup Preview Example Here is some incorrect Markdown. CSS . superfences-tabs { display : flex ; position : relative ; flex-wrap : wrap ; } . superfences-tabs . highlight { background : #ddd ; } . superfences-tabs . superfences-content { display : none ; order : 99 ; width : 100 % ; } . superfences-tabs label { width : auto ; margin : 0 0.5 em ; padding : 0.25 em ; font-size : 120 % ; cursor : pointer ; } . superfences-tabs input { position : absolute ; opacity : 0 ; } . superfences-tabs input : nth-child ( n + 1 ) { color : #333333 ; } . superfences-tabs input : nth-child ( n + 1 ) : checked + label { color : #FF5252 ; } . superfences-tabs input : nth-child ( n + 1 ) : checked + label + . superfences-content { display : block ; } Line Number Example Source ``` linenums="1" import foo.bar ``` Output import foo.bar Special Line Example Source ``` linenums="1 1 2" """Some file.""" import foo.bar import boo.baz import foo.bar.baz ``` Output """Some file.""" import foo.bar import boo.baz import foo.bar.baz Highlight Lines with Line Numbers Example Source ```hl_lines="1 3" linenums="2" """Some file.""" import foo.bar import boo.baz import foo.bar.baz ``` Output """Some file.""" import foo.bar import boo.baz import foo.bar.baz https://facelessuser.github.io/pymdown-extensions/extensions/superfences/#uml-diagram-example Flow Chart Example Output st=>start: Start:>http://www.google.com[blank] e=>end:>http://www.google.com op1=>operation: My Operation sub1=>subroutine: My Subroutine cond=>condition: Yes or No?:>http://www.google.com io=>inputoutput: catch something... st->op1->cond cond(yes)->io->e cond(no)->sub1(right)->op1 Source ```flow st=>start: Start:>http://www.google.com[blank] e=>end:>http://www.google.com op1=>operation: My Operation sub1=>subroutine: My Subroutine cond=>condition: Yes or No?:>http://www.google.com io=>inputoutput: catch something... st->op1->cond cond(yes)->io->e cond(no)->sub1(right)->op1 ``` Sequence Diagram Example Output Title: Here is a title A->B: Normal line B-->C: Dashed line C->>D: Open arrow D-->>A: Dashed open arrow Source ```sequence Title: Here is a title A->B: Normal line B-->C: Dashed line C->>D: Open arrow D-->>A: Dashed open arrow ``` https://mermaidjs.github.io/ Flow Diagram Example Output graph TD; A-->B; A-->C; B-->D; C-->D; Source ```mermaid graph TD; A-->B; A-->C; B-->D; C-->D; ``` Sequence Diagram Example Output sequenceDiagram participant Alice participant Bob Alice->John: Hello John, how are you? loop Healthcheck John->John: Fight against hypochondria end Note right of John: Rational thoughts
prevail... John-->Alice: Great! John->Bob: How about you? Bob-->John: Jolly good! Source ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Alice participant Bob Alice->John: Hello John, how are you? loop Healthcheck John->John: Fight against hypochondria end Note right of John: Rational thoughts
prevail... John-->Alice: Great! John->Bob: How about you? Bob-->John: Jolly good! ``` Gantt Diagram Example Output gantt dateFormat YYYY-MM-DD title Adding GANTT diagram functionality to mermaid section A section Completed task :done, des1, 2014-01-06,2014-01-08 Active task :active, des2, 2014-01-09, 3d Future task : des3, after des2, 5d Future task2 : des4, after des3, 5d section Critical tasks Completed task in the critical line :crit, done, 2014-01-06,24h Implement parser and jison :crit, done, after des1, 2d Create tests for parser :crit, active, 3d Future task in critical line :crit, 5d Create tests for renderer :2d Add to mermaid :1d Source ```mermaid gantt dateFormat YYYY-MM-DD title Adding GANTT diagram functionality to mermaid section A section Completed task :done, des1, 2014-01-06,2014-01-08 Active task :active, des2, 2014-01-09, 3d Future task : des3, after des2, 5d Future task2 : des4, after des3, 5d section Critical tasks Completed task in the critical line :crit, done, 2014-01-06,24h Implement parser and jison :crit, done, after des1, 2d Create tests for parser :crit, active, 3d Future task in critical line :crit, 5d Create tests for renderer :2d Add to mermaid :1d ```
docs.title: SuperFences

docs.text: Auto-Linking Example - Just paste links directly in the document like this: https://google.com. - Or even an email address: fake.email@email.com. Just paste links directly in the document like this: https://google.com . Or even an email address: fake.email@email.com .

This is a footnote content. ↩ A footnote on the label: "@#$%". ↩ The first paragraph of the definition. Paragraph two of the definition. A blockquote with multiple lines. a code block A final paragraph. ↩
